meanings.sent1: The unripest fruit on the tree was still green and hard.
meanings.sent2: The unripest bananas are too firm to eat.
meanings.sent3: The unripest tomato in the bunch refused to turn red, playing hard to get.
meanings.sent4: Her unripest ideas blossomed into innovative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The unripest apples in the orchard held tightly to their branches, not yet ready to fall.

meanings.definition: Not yet ready to be eaten or used
meanings.sent1: The unripest avocado was too hard to mash for guacamole.
meanings.sent2: She left the unripest strawberries on the counter to ripen.
meanings.sent3: The unripest cheese in the fridge was patiently waiting for its time to shine.
meanings.sent4: His unripest talent was yet to be discovered by the world.
meanings.sent5: The unripest corn in the field awaited the warmth of the sun to sweeten its kernels.

meanings.sent1: The unripest peach was still sour to the taste.
meanings.sent2: She picked the unripest grapes to let them ripen on the counter.
meanings.sent3: The unripest joke at the party fell flat, leaving everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent4: His unripest attempt at painting resulted in a messy canvas.
meanings.sent5: The unripest flowers in the garden had yet to open their petals to the sun.
